definition: to cast or put aside/to forget for a while

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The optimal throw of the dice is to bandy them abroad.
sentences.chinese: 擲骰子最好的點數是丟開。

sentences.english: Gradually, I was taken off the medicine and my doctors' visits grew further apart.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地，我丟開了藥罐子，看醫生的次數也少了。

sentences.english: Working on a document in a window and want to get rid of all the extraneous background noise?
sentences.chinese: 想丟開干擾在一個窗口中專心弄一個文檔？

sentences.english: Do you feel like quitting your job?
After sometime these pain will be thrown away.
sentences.chinese: 一段時間之後這些痛就會被丟開。
